head.title: Coronavirus Information - Health Services - ABC Unified School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: The ABC Unified School District is known throughout the State of California as a leader in educational planning and innovation. The District has received county, state, and national recognition for outstanding programs in counseling, alternative education, staff development, and labor relations.

li.a: State of the District - Dr. Mary Sieu
Monday Message from Dr. Mary Sieu
Elementary Schools Online Learning at Home Family Guidance

California Healthy Kids Surveys for Students
Sexual Health & HIV Prevention Education - Grade 6
CA Healthy Youth Act (Sexual Health & HIV Prevention Education) - Grades 7-12

div.span: This page is dedicated to providing updates and information about the COVID-19 virus and its impact on the ABC Unified School District. Please check back here often for updates. ABC Unified School District schools are closed for the remainder of the school year through June 10, 2020. This decision to close schools for the rest of the school year is in alignment with Governor Gavin Newsom, State Superintendent of Public Instruction, Tony Thurmond, and Dr. Debra Duardo, Superintendent of the L.A. County Office of Education. Students will continue to participate in the ABC Online Learning at Home.

div.div: The ABC Unified School District will communicate to our parents and community during this unprecedented time of school closures.

p.span: REMINDER – Please practice hand washing and social distancing. Even though local parks are open, games or activities that require close contact are strongly discouraged.

ul.li: ABC Unified prohibits district employees from discriminating against or harassing any other district employee or job applicant on the basis of the person's actual or perceived race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sex or sexual orientation.
